snippet: In a striking contrast from six weeks ago, battles in Syria’s largest city, Aleppo, have spread into areas that had been sheltered, threatening to open new rifts among ethnic groups.
abstract: Chaos continues to spread in Aleppo, Syria's largest city, as rebels attack towering municipality building with rockets, sending civil servants fleeing from one of the few government buildings still functioning; situation in capital has shifted dramatically over past six weeks with many municipal services suspended and police stations abandoned.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Aleppo, Syria.

lead_paragraph: In a striking contrast from six weeks ago, battles in Syria’s largest city, Aleppo, have spread into areas that had been sheltered, threatening to open new rifts among ethnic groups.

headline.seo: Fighting Spreads Through Syrian City as Services Vanish
headline.main: Fighting and Chaos Spread Through Syrian City, as Services Vanish
headline.print_headline: Fighting and Chaos Spread Through Syrian City, as Services Vanish

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
